result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel R Sharkey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.

miscConds.notes: CONDITIONS OF PROBATION (and Extended Supervision, if revoked):
No controlled substances or alcohol; urine screens. No contact with the victim, Mr. Craig N.
Seek and maintain employment. Cognitive thinking intervention counseling. Be given job and vocational training.

Pay the DNA surcharge, costs, disbursements and supervision fees.  Should defendant get revoked, Court ordered monies taken from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on extended supervision. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant, which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy.

timeConds.notes: With Huber and good time. To be used at the discretion of agent for any violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel R Sharkey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Samuel R Sharkey in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Dax C. Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel R Sharkey in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Dax C Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant sworn.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.   The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20 and that all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 8:30 am.

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 6-19-2014 at 8:30 am for plea and sentencing.  Defendant is serving a sentence with huber in Washington County.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Parties request a new date. Defendant is serving a Huber sentence in Washington County.  Case is rescheduled with ADA Odom (by telphone) and Attorney McCandless (in court here today) to 6/19/14 at 8:30 a.m. for plea and sentencing.  Notice mailed via Interoffice mail to ADA Odom; notice provided to Attorney McCandless in person in court today.

Defendant Samuel R Sharkey in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Jay R Pucek appeared for Dax Odom for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Samuel R Sharkey in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Joy Hammond for Dax C. Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CRAIG N. AND WALMART.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Samuel R Sharkey
Current: 3531 W BRENTLING LANE, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 03-13-2014)
Prior: 1860 N Warren Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53202

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Samuel R Sharkey in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Samuel R Sharkey in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
